availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dickson G. Fowler (Paducah, Kentucky, boat captain)

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, boat captain. Kentucky native. Married to Laura Berry in McCracken County on May 17, 1853. Father of Laura Fowler. Married to Geraldine Porter in Henry County, Tennessee, on October 20, 1859. Commission merchant in McCracken County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Find A Grave, "Dickson G. Fowler" (February 3, 1830 - May 17, 1876)," Memorial #73784133, www.findagrave.com/memorial/73784133 (accessed June 2, 2017).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 110.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, McCracken County Marriages, Film #002132060, p. 191.
Tennessee State Marriages (1780-2002), Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Henry County Marriages.
